intro: Chaetogastra citrina, commonly known as the yellow chaetogastra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Chaetogastra citrina is typically found in open grasslands and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
